entry.title: Re: NFC scanning in SAP MDK for Android.
entry.content:
We don't offer out of the box NFC support.  It can be done but will depend on what you are looking to do.  Are you planning on just using the NFC capabilities of most every Android device or are you looking to use something else (specialized device, external hardware scanner, etc)?

There is a Nativescript plugin (nativescript-nfc) but it would need to be updated to be compatible with the latest MDK versions.  The plugin is community provided so updates are not in our direct control.  There are also some forks of the repo you could also investigate that may have been updated.

Alternatively you could create your own plugin to enable the NFC scanning as well.  MDK also introduced the ability to override the default scanning button for search and simple property fields where you could call the NFC scanning instead of the default camera scanning.

entry.title: Re: how to find more Information about a Business Key Fig...
entry.content:
Each of the Key Figures that appear in the EWA report can be mapped to an Object ID, you can check the below Object IDs mapping.
Order To Cash:  Overdue Outbound Deliveries [K11]  KPLE000110
Order To Cash:  Deliveries with overdue invoices [K12]  KPLE000114
Order To Cash:  Orders not billed (Order related billing) [K06]  KPSD000123
Order To Cash:  Orders billed not delivered [K07]   KPSD000122
Order To Cash:  Sales Order Schedule Line Items overdue [K04]   KPSD000303 

To find more Information about a Business Key Figure Alert in the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA), please use the Object ID as the Monitoring Object input in transaction ST13 - tool name: TBI_REPORTS in the managed system.
For more detailed steps, please refer the step 15-step 21 mentioned in KBA 3401587 - How To Find More Information About a Business Key Figure Alert in the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) 

And please also refer to Point #3 in KBA 2197502:
In case you would like to get more details about a Key Figure that was highlighed in EWA, SAP Readiness Check 2.0, Next Generation SAP Business Scenario Recommendations or SAP Innovation and Optimization Pathfinder, you should setup Business Process Analytics and perform deeper analysis with the functions available within BPIMp. You can contact your SAP Account representative to request more information about the available services. Please check the Business Process Improvement wiki page here.

entry.title: Re: ケース起票時にSOLMAN・SIDのシステム項目が選択できない
entry.content:
ケース起票時にSOLMAN・SIDのシステム項目が選択できない原因は、
SOA、SOJ のインストール番号がパートナーによってサポートされているためです。

このため、SOA、SOJでケース起票が必要な場合、直接パートナーに
ご依頼いただけますでしょうか。 

また、各インストール番号がパートナー経由のサポートであるかどうかは、
https://me.sap.com/app/installationsよりご確認いただけます。

具体的には、Supported By欄にパートナー情報が付いているものはパートナー経由であるため、
貴社からケース起票はできません。一方、何もついてないものは貴社によってケースを起票いただけます。

念のため、詳細について記載されているKBAをお送りいたしますので、ご参考になれば幸いです。
2426344 - Can customers supported by a VAR Partner create and view cases? - SAP for Me

もし、特定のインストール番号に関するパートナー経由のサポートを受けたくなくなったり、
サポートパートナーの情報を変更したい場合は、直接SAPオーダーマネジメント部署にメールにてご依頼ください。

メールアドレス：sapcontractcenter@sap.com

2929126 - How to add or update the partner listed in the 'Supported By' for an installation number - SAP for Me

上記内容について何かご質問や不明な点等がございましたら、お気軽にご連絡ください。 

SAPサポート
Judy

entry.title: Re: Short Dump error KE549 in CO-PA postings
entry.content:
The ABAP dump you're encountering during FI posting in a new company code—triggered by error message KE549 in CO-PA—is due to an undefined or invalid program state in the profitability analysis interface. Specifically, the system fails to process the CO-PA segment because the underlying data basis or configuration is incomplete or inconsistent.
This typically occurs when the CO-PA interface program cannot resolve the correct profitability segment or value field mapping during actual value flow.

SAP Note 1746096 identifies the root cause of KE549 dumps during CO-PA postings and recommends applying a pilot correction and SAP Pilot Note 2377261 is a restricted-access note that contains the actual fix for the KE549 dump. You must request SAP Support to be added to the pilot note. It’s not publicly downloadable.

Action:

  • Open an incident with SAP Support referencing Note 1746096 and request access to Pilot Note 2377261.
  • Include the full ST22 dump and the DIAG values (FBB1, 0010, AUD, USD) in your incident.
  • SAP will evaluate and either grant access to the pilot note or provide a workaround.

entry.title: Re: Cash Journal
entry.content:
The Cash Journal in SAP offers several practical and strategic benefits, especially for organizations that handle frequent petty cash or manual cash transactions. Here's a breakdown of its main advantages:

  • All cash receipts and payments are recorded in one place. Simplifies monitoring of daily cash activities.
  • SAP automatically ensures that the cash balance cannot go negative, helping maintain financial discipline.
  • You can view the opening and closing balances instantly. Supports better liquidity management and decision-making.
  • Cash journal entries are transferred to the General Ledger in a controlled manner. Reduces manual errors and ensures consistency in accounting.
  • Transactions can be analyzed by day, week, or month. Supports audit readiness and financial transparency.
  • Single-screen transaction for entering, displaying, and editing entries. Supports printing of receipts and journal summaries.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent express item from being sent to sap inbox
entry.content:
SAP does not provide a standard personal setting to stop Express Work Items from appearing in the inbox. These items are designed to grab attention immediately and bypass normal inbox filters.

Since you don't want to lower the priority, you have to explore custom validation via BAdI WF_BWP_SELECT_FILTER which allows filtering of work items shown in the inbox. You can implement logic to exclude specific Express Work Items based on user, task, or context.
If the user should not receive the work item, adjust the agent rules to exclude them. This is especially useful when substitutes are active.
If you're dealing with substitutes and both primary and substitute users are receiving Express Work Items, that’s standard SAP behavior. You’d need to remove the primary user from agent determination Or use filtering logic in the BAdI to suppress delivery to the primary user.

entry.title: Re: IW36: Copying Settlement Rules in the Child Order
entry.content:
You're using IW36 via BDC to create a child PM order from a superior order, and you want to copy the settlement rules from the superior order into the child order before it's created, ideally within the IF_EX_WORKORDER_UPDATE~AT_SAVE method of the BAdI.

The key constraints are

  • The method AT_SAVE is triggered after the order is created, not before.
  • At the time this method runs, the child order number is already assigned.
  • The BAdI interface IF_EX_WORKORDER_UPDATE provides limited importing parameters—mainly the order number and some header data.

What you can do is use AT_SAVE to Copy Settlement Rules. You can read the superior order using AUFK or COBRB tables. Then copy its settlement rules into the newly created child order using function modules like:

  • K_SETTLEMENT_RULE_READ
  • K_SETTLEMENT_RULE_SAVE

This works only if the child order is already created and has a valid order number.

Alternatively, if you need to intervene before the order is created, consider:

  • User Exit IWO10009 – for PM order creation.
  • Enhancement Point in IW36 screen logic – if you control the BDC flow.

entry.title: Re: SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 - determination rule owner ID
entry.content:
@Sanne wrote:

Hi,

in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 i would like to build a determination rule for the Owner field of the Account. It should be defaulted with the current user id. Does anyone know if that is possible? Is there a system user variable that can be used in the assignment block part of the determination rule? I tried the field adminData/CreatedBy but it does not work when i link it to the ownerID.

many thanks,

Sanne

 

Yes, it is possible to default the Owner field of an Account to the current user in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. The determination rules for party roles, including the Owner, are configured in the Business Configuration work center. Within the Maintain Determination settings for the Owner role, there is a specific step called "Current User". You should activate this step and ensure it has the highest priority in the sequence. By doing this, the system will automatically default the Owner to the user who is currently logged in and creating the account, assuming no higher-priority rules (like "Employee Responsible of Account Team") are also active and determining a value.

entry.title: Re: Request for Workaround – Inclusion of Storage Locatio...
entry.content:
On the MB5B selection screen, see that “Totals Only – Non-Hierarchical Representation” box is not checked. If that is also not showing, then, consider developing a custom report with the below tables

  • MARD (Storage Location Data for Material)
  • MBEW (Valuation Data)
  • MSEG/MKPF (Material Documents)

This allows full control over layout and fields.

If you're using S/4HANA, activate the business function LOG_MM_OPTIMIZATIONS and BAdI MM_UI_OPTIMIZATIONS to enable ALV grid enhancements for MB5B. You can also define a custom layout variant in MB5B and check if SLoc appears under hidden fields (though often it’s not available).

entry.title: Re: Integration Suite and Connection Type G for synchronous BAPIs?
entry.content:
Hi CodemadeinGermany

I assume it's not possible what you like to achieve. With SAP PI there was an RFC Sender Adapter. So ABAP Backend is connected via registered Server Program to PI (RFC Dest. Type "T"). PI was then loading the Meta data to simulate an ABAP Backend. With RFC Dest. Type "G" and "H", SAP is just doing an ordinary HTTP-POST. I am not aware there is anything that translates the plain BAPI call into XML context in the Backend.

Can you explain why you don't want to connect the two ABAP Systems directly? Passing the payload between two SAP systems makes only imo sense, if you have to manipulate the payload. 

BR Helmut

entry.title: Re: Call Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application us...
entry.content:
You have to use the OAuth-based authentication flow, see https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/sap-successfactors-api-reference-guide-odata-v2/authentication-using-oauth-2-0. Only step 1 has to be done by you, step 2 and 3 is done by the destination service. Step 4 is your CAP logic.

First step would be to register a new OAuth client in SFSF using the X509 from your BTP account, eg: https://github.com/SAP-archive/cap-appgyver-covid-certcheck/blob/main/tutorials/2_EmployeeLookupService/README.md#establish-trust-between-btp-subaccount-destination-service-and-successfactors-tenant

Then you can create a BTP destination specifying the 'userIdSource' containing the (mapped) user id for SFSF, eg: https://github.com/SAP-archive/cap-appgyver-covid-certcheck/blob/main/tutorials/2_EmployeeLookupService/README.md#create-destination-for-successfactors

In case your SFSF user id is not your email or IAS user ID, you can map it to a different profile field (eg "sfsf_userid") you have in the IAS Assertion, e.g. "$['user_attributes']['sfsf_userid'][0]"

entry.title: Modern, searchable abap2xlsx documentation — now live (AI-assisted). Please help validate!
entry.content:
Intro
I’m happy to announce a modern, VitePress-based documentation site for abap2xlsx that I put together to make the library easier to approach and use: https://kartefact.github.io/abap2xlsx-docs/.

Why I built this
abap2xlsx is a powerful, community-driven project for reading and generating Excel workbooks from ABAP, but a newcomer can still get lost between scattered wiki pages, demo repos, and issue threads. The new site collects Getting-Started guides, API examples, troubleshooting tips and practical recipes in one place so you can get productive faster. (The canonical abap2xlsx repo is maintained under the abap2xlsx GitHub organization.) GitHubAbap2xlsx

What the site contains (high level)

  • Quickstart / installation (abapGit recommended)

  • API reference with short working examples and copy-paste snippets

  • Practical guides (ALV → Excel, templates, huge files, xlsm)

  • Troubleshooting and FAQ compiled from common issues and demo programs
    All of this is published on GitHub here so it’s open for PRs and improvements: https://github.com/kartefact/abap2xlsx-docs.

Credits & inspiration (please read)

  • abap2xlsx — the original project and community. Many thanks to the project and its maintainers for building and sustaining this library. See the canonical repo for project details. GitHub

  • Ivan Femia — original author and an early maintainer of abap2xlsx (see the project history and Ivan’s GitHub profile). GitHub+1

  • abap2UI5 — the idea to use VitePress and the overall documentation style was inspired by the excellent VitePress-based documentation for abap2UI5. I owe the abap2UI5 team and contributors a big thank-you for the inspiration and for showing how a docs site can make a project more approachable. GitHub+1

  • Devin / DeepWiki (AI assistance) — the draft content for a large portion of the docs was produced using Devin’s DeepWiki features as a productivity aid (Devin / DeepWiki indexes code and produces a first-pass docs/wiki). Because the site grew from those AI-generated drafts, accuracy needs human validation — see the “Accuracy & validation” section below. docs.devin.aiCognition

Important — AI & accuracy notice (please help validate)
A big portion of the initial text and structure was generated with the help of Devin (DeepWiki). Devin is an AI tool designed to index repos and produce wikis, which I used to speed up drafting. While AI helped assemble and format the content, it can — and sometimes does — introduce inaccuracies or omit contextual details. I therefore explicitly invite the abap2xlsx maintainers and the wider community to review, correct, and improve the docs. Please treat the site as a community draft until verified. docs.devin.aidevin.ai

Community review & how you can help

  • Found a mistake in an API example? Open a PR against kartefact/abap2xlsx-docs. GitHub

  • Prefer the docs maintained inside the official abap2xlsx org? I opened a proposal issue in the main abap2xlsx repo to suggest modernizing the official docs; that issue is visible on the project’s Issues list. As of writing, it hasn’t received a maintainer reply — I welcome the maintainers to take this work into the official org for broader reach. I’m happy to transfer the repo or collaborate on integrating the docs into the abap2xlsx org. GitHub+1

How maintainers can adopt / transfer
If the abap2xlsx maintainers want this under the abap2xlsx GitHub organization (preferred for discoverability), I’m completely happy to:

  1. Add maintainers as collaborators and/or admins on the kartefact/abap2xlsx-docs repo. GitHub

  2. Transfer the repo into the abap2xlsx GitHub org on request (GitHub transfer requires a receiving org invite).

  3. Or I can open a PR with the site content (docs markdown) for maintainers to import into their docs repo — whatever the maintainers prefer.

If you’re a maintainer, please reply to the issue I opened or DM me on GitHub; I’ll follow your preference. GitHub+1

Disclaimers (legal / social / philosophical)

  • This site is an independent, community resource created to help developers. It is not an official SAP product announcement nor an official abap2xlsx governance decision. GitHub

  • The content was AI-assisted. While I have manually reviewed and edited the material, do not rely solely on this site for production-critical or security-sensitive decisions. Validate examples in an appropriate test system before deploying. docs.devin.ai

  • I respect project maintainers and contributors — the intention is collaboration and service to the community, not disruption. If any maintainer prefers a different route, I will promptly follow that direction or hand the repo over.

  • This announcement is technical and community-focused; it is not a political or legal statement and is not intended to offend or challenge anyone. If anything needs rephrasing to meet community standards, please tell me and I’ll update the wording.

Closing & call to action
If you use abap2xlsx, please take two minutes to:

  1. Browse the docs: https://kartefact.github.io/abap2xlsx-docs/

  2. Open issues or PRs on https://github.com/kartefact/abap2xlsx-docs if you see anything wrong or missing.

  3. If you’re a maintainer and want this inside the official org, please respond to the issue I filed — I’ll gladly hand this over or collaborate. GitHub

Thank you to everyone who has built and supported abap2xlsx and abap2UI5. My only aim in creating these docs is to make the tools more accessible and useful for the community. Let’s improve this together.

entry.title: cTMS Setup for SAP Analytical Cloud (SAC)
entry.content:
Introduction

The cTMS setup process is mostly similar to SAP Datasphere, only difference is, SAC tenants are provisioned by SAP, and the tenant details are provided directly by them, where as SAP Datasphere tenants are typically provisioned by the customer through BTP subaccounts within their own BTP Global Account.

As a result, SAC tenants are not part of your existing BTP Global Account, but instead reside in a separate Global Account that is linked to your SAP customer number. Let us dive deep into the procedure of setting up cTMS for SAC. 

cTMS Architecture – SAP Analytical Cloud

Here we have four environments Dev, QA, UAT, and Prod, each corresponding to a separate SAC Account. We have provisioned the Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS) in a separate subaccount. The SAC development team develop/configure various content packages and export the same from the Dev SAC tenant using Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS), which then adds the transport to the QA node. From there, it is imported into QA and the subsequent environments (UAT, Prod) through Solution Manager (SolMan), leveraging Focused Build (FB) or ChaRM status transitions.

Additionally, this setup can be integrated with SAP Cloud ALM

Setup Steps:

Since several of these SaaS applications share common setup steps, please begin by following the initial setup steps outlined here Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions 

Step1: Setup OAuth Client in SAC

To enable integration via Destinations, you must set up an OAuth client in each SAP SAC tenant.

Login to SAP SAC and follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to:
    System > Administration > App Integration > OAuth Clients

  2. Click on "Configure Clients"

  3. Select "Add a New OAuth Client" to create a new client configuration.

Name: Give appropriate name
Purpose: API Access
Access: Analytical Content Network Interaction
Security: Client credentials
Token lifetime: by default 1 hour, you can extend it up to 24 hrs.

Note: Make sure to copy and securely store the Client ID and Client Secret.
The Client Secret will not be visible again after you click Add.

Step2: Create Destinations to SAC Tenants

In the subaccount where the Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) service is subscribed, create a destination to each target SAP SAC Tenant. 

Name: Give appropriate name to resemble your CTMS Node

URL:https://<SACTenant>.<region>.hcs.cloud.sap/api/v1/content/deploy/

Token Service URL: https://<SACTenant>.authentication.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

Use the Client id and Secret you setup in step1 above. 

Step3: Configure Transport Nodes in cTMS

Prerequisites

  • You have been assigned one of the following roles: Administrator or LandscapeOperator.

From the cTMS UI, you can define transport nodes to represent your system landscape. There are multiple ways to create a node:

You can either Create a node on the Landscape Visualization screen or from Transport Nodes screen. 

Allow Upload to Node: Enable this checkbox to allow file uploads to the node. Enabled for the Dev node only. 

Forward Mode: Default value is Auto, You can change this setting based on your landscape and transport flow requirements.

Controlled by SAP Solution Manager: Select this checkbox only if you plan to integrate with SAP Solution Manager (e.g., Charm or Focused Build). We will only enable this for QA and upper environments.  When you enable this, it will not allow manual imports from cTMS UI, only through Charm/FB status change. 

Note: If you plan to integrate with Cloud ALM, do not check this option. 

Content Type: For SAP SAC, select Application Content.

Destination: Select the appropriate target destination you previously configured in your cTMS subaccount in Step2.

Step4: Create Transport routes in cTMS

In SAP Cloud Transport Management, transport routes are used to connect transport nodes.

Name: Provide the appropriate name

Chose the Source node & Target node and click on OK. 

Your landscape loos like this

Note: You can also use Transport Landscape Wizard, with which you can setup the all your landscape nodes & routes at a time.

Step5: SAC Configuration

To enable cTMS integration in SAP Analytical Cloud, you have to connect it to cTMS by following these steps:

  1. Log in to the Dev SAP SAC tenant

  2. Go to: Transport → Export

  3. Navigate to the Content Network Storage tab and select My Content

  4. In the menu bar, click Settings

  5. Upload the cTMS service key (in JSON format)

  6. Once successfully uploaded, the status will change to Live, indicating that the integration is active

Now the option to upload content to cTMS becomes available.

  • Select the content package(s) you want to transport

  • Click the "Upload to cTMS" option to export the content to Cloud Transport Management Service

This will initiate the transport process and push the selected content to the configured QA node.

Step6: Integrate with Solution Manager

To integrate Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) with SAP Solution Manager (Charm / Focused Build), follow the step6 from below article. 

If you want to integrate with Cloud ALM, follow the step7 from below article. 

 Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions 

Conclusion:

I hope you have learned, how to setup cTMS for SAP Analytical Cloud. Now the setup is complete and ready for transporting the content using cTMS either integrated with SAP Solution Manager or Cloud ALM.

Thank you for reading  my article, feel free to provide any feedback or comment for any questions.

Thanks,
Raghu

entry.title: Integrating SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis Cloud with Jenkins: A Practical Guide
entry.content:
Integrating SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis with Jenkins: A Practical Guide

Seamless integration of test automation into the CI/CD pipeline is essential in today's DevOps landscape. SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis, especially the recently released full SaaS version, enables automated tests to be executed at scale with minimal effort. This post will teach you how to integrate SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis with Jenkins, run tests automatically, and retrieve results directly within the build process.

Prerequisites:

To follow this guide, you’ll need:

  • 🖥 A Jenkins server (local or remote) with admin privileges
  • ✅ A configured Playlist in SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis
  • 🤖 An active Team-Agent in SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis
  • 🔐 Admin access in SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis to obtain API credentials
  • 🪪 A valid SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis API access token

Step-by-step instructions

📡 Set Up SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis API Access

  • Open the Swagger documentation of your tenant: https://<your_tenant>.my-sap.tricentis.com/_identity/apiDocs/swagger/index.html
  • Authenticate via the "Authorize" button.
  • Execute GET /_identity/api/v1/applications and locate the entry Tricentis_Cloud_API.
  • Copy the corresponding ID.
  • Use that ID to execute GET /_identity/api/v1/applications/{id}/secrets to retrieve your clientSecret.

🛠️ Configure Jenkins Pipeline

In Jenkins, create a new Pipeline job and define the following environment block:

    environment {
        CLIENT_ID     = 'Tricentis_Cloud_API' //Client ID from the identity service: https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/references/tosca_apis.htm
        CLIENT_SECRET = '<CLIENT_SECRET>'
        E2G_SCOPE     = 'tta'
        E2G_AUTH_URL  = '<Token_URL>' //https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/admin_guide/get_client_secret.htm
        TTA_URL       = '<URL of your Tenant>' //Your ECT Cloud tenant URL including the workspace name
        PLAYLIST_ID   = 'Playlist ID from your playlist URL'
    }
  • E2G_AUTH_URL, can be copied from Swagger after authorization:
    • Select “Authorize”
    • Copy Token URL

  • TTA_URL depends on your workspace. In our example, we used “Default”.  
  • PLAYLIST_ID, can be found in SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis under Playlists (copy from the URL)
    • https://<your_tenant>.my-sap.tricentis.com/_portal/space/Default/playlists/edit/<playlistID>
  • You can also parameterize values such as PLAYLIST_ID for more flexibility.

In the script section, you have to add the name of the parameter.

    environment {
        CLIENT_ID     = 'Tricentis_Cloud_API' //Client ID from the identity service: https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/references/tosca_apis.htm
        CLIENT_SECRET = '<CLIENT_SECRET>'
        E2G_SCOPE     = 'tta'
        E2G_AUTH_URL  = '<Token_URL>' //https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/admin_guide/get_client_secret.htm
        TTA_URL       = '<URL of your Tenant>' //Your ECT Cloud tenant URL including the workspace name
        PLAYLIST_ID   = "${PlaylistId}"
    }

🔑 Script – Get Token

This stage makes a secure request to get your OAuth2 access token.

  • Request type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
  • Parameters: client_id, client_secret, scope, grant_type
  • If successful, the access_token is saved to a file (e.g., access_token.txt)
  • If not, the pipeline exits with an error
stage('Get Token') {
						powershell '''
						$headers = @{
							"Content-Type" = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
						}
						#Getting the access token as pre-authentication based on the manual: https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/admin_guide/get_client_secret.htm
						$Body = "client_id=$env:CLIENT_ID&client_secret=$env:CLIENT_SECRET&scope=$env:E2G_SCOPE&grant_type=client_credentials"
						$maxRetries = 3
						$retryCount = 0
						$success = $false
						do {
							try {
								$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "$env:E2G_AUTH_URL" -Method "Post" -Headers $headers -Body $Body
								#Save access token from response
								$accessToken = $response.access_token
								$success = $true
								Write-Host "Token acquired successfully."
							}
							catch {
								$retryCount++
								Write-Host "Token acquisition failed (attempt $retryCount of $maxRetries): $($_.Exception.Message)"
								if ($retryCount -lt $maxRetries) {
									Start-Sleep -Seconds 5
								}
							}
						} while (-not $success -and $retryCount -lt $maxRetries)
						if (-not $success) {
							throw "Failed to acquire token after $maxRetries attempts"
						}
						# Save token to file for use in subsequent stages
						$accessToken | Out-File -FilePath "access_token.txt" -Encoding UTF8
						'''
					}

🚀 Script – Run Tests

Using the token:

  • Read the token from access_token.txt
  • Send a POST request to /api/v2/playlistRuns/ with the playlist ID
  • Save the returned executionId to execution_id.txt – you’ll need it to track progress
stage('Run Tests') {
						powershell '''
						#Read access token from temporary file
						$accessToken = Get-Content -Path "access_token.txt" -Raw
						$accessToken = $accessToken.Trim()
						function StartPlaylistExecution {
							param(
								[string]$AccessToken,
								[string]$TtaUrl,
								[string]$PlaylistId
							)
							try {
								$headers = @{
									"Authorization" = "Bearer $AccessToken"
									"Content-Type" = "application/json"
									"Accept" = "application/json"
								}
								$body = @{
									"playlistId" = $PlaylistId
									"private" = $false
								} | ConvertTo-Json
								$fullUrl = "$TtaURL/_playlists/api/v2/playlistRuns/"
								Write-Host "Calling: $fullUrl"
								#Sending playlist run of specific playlist based on the Playlist ID provided
								$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $fullUrl -Method Post -Headers $headers -Body $body
								if ($response.executionId) {
									return $response.executionId
								} elseif ($response.id) {
									return $response.id
								} else {
									throw "No execution ID returned."
								}
							}
							catch {
								Write-Error "Execution failed: $($_.Exception.Message)"
								throw
							}
						}
						$executionId = StartPlaylistExecution $accessToken $env:TTA_URL $env:PLAYLIST_ID
						Write-Host "Execution triggered. ID: $executionId"
						# Save execution ID to file for use in subsequent stages
						$executionId | Out-File -FilePath "execution_id.txt" -Encoding UTF8
						'''
					}

⏱ Script – Wait for Results

Your pipeline now polls SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis every 30 seconds to check test status:

  • Possible states: running, succeeded, failed, canceled
  • Once completed, the status is saved to test_state.txt
  • On failure: pipeline exits immediately with an error code
stage('Wait for Results') {
                            powershell '''
                                # Read token and execution ID from files
                                $accessToken = Get-Content -Path "access_token.txt" -Raw
                                $accessToken = $accessToken.Trim()
                                $executionId = Get-Content -Path "execution_id.txt" -Raw
                                $executionId = $executionId.Trim()
                                
                                function WaitForExecution {
                                    param(
                                        [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
                                        [string]$AccessToken,
                                        
                                        [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
                                        [string]$TtaUrl,
                                        
                                        [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
                                        [string]$ExecutionId,
                                        
                                        [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
                                        [int]$TimeoutMinutes = 60,
                                        
                                        [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
                                        [int]$PollingIntervalSeconds = 30
                                    )
                                    
                                    try {
                                        $headers = @{
                                            "Authorization" = "Bearer $AccessToken"
                                            "Content-Type" = "application/json"
                                        }
                                        
                                        $startTime = Get-Date
                                        $timeoutTime = $startTime.AddMinutes($TimeoutMinutes)
                                        
                                        Write-Host "Waiting for execution with Playlist ID $ExecutionId to complete..."
                                        
                                        do {
                                            $response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "$TtaUrl/_playlists/api/v2/playlistRuns/$ExecutionId" -Method Get -Headers $headers
                                            
                                            $status = $response.state
                                            $playListName = $response.playlistName
                                            Write-Host "Current execution status: $status"
                                            
                                            if ($status -eq "Completed" -or $status -eq "succeeded") {
                                                return "succeeded"
                                            }
                                            
                                            if ($status -eq "Failed" -or $status -eq "failed") {
                                                return "failed"
                                            }
                                            
                                            if ($status -eq "Cancelled" -or $status -eq "canceled" -or $status -eq "canceling") {
                                                return "canceled"
                                            }
                                            
                                            if ((Get-Date) -gt $timeoutTime) {
                                                Write-Host "Execution timed out after $TimeoutMinutes minutes"
                                                return $null
                                            }
                                            #Wait x amount of seconds and check again if Playlist run has finished
                                            Write-Host "Execution of Playlist $playListName still running. Waiting $PollingIntervalSeconds seconds before next check..."
                                            Start-Sleep -Seconds $PollingIntervalSeconds
                                            
                                        } while ($status -eq "Running" -or $status -eq "Pending" -or $status -eq "Starting")
                                        
                                        return $status
                                    }
                                    catch {
                                        Write-Error "Failed to wait for execution: $($_.Exception.Message)"
                                        throw
                                    }
                                }
                                
                                $currentState = WaitForExecution $accessToken $env:TTA_URL $executionId
                                
                                if ($currentState -eq $null) {
                                    throw "Execution timed out"
                                }
                                if ($currentState -eq 'canceling' -or $currentState -eq 'canceled') {
                                    throw "Execution Canceled"
                                }
								# Stops pipeline if playlist execution has status failed. Remove if you want to release with a failed playlist run.
								if ($currentState -eq 'failing' -or $currentState -eq 'failed') {
                                    throw "Execution Failed"
                                }
                                
                                Write-Host "Test execution completed with state: $currentState"
                                
                                # Save test state to file for use in subsequent stages
                                $currentState | Out-File -FilePath "test_state.txt" -Encoding UTF8
                            '''
					}

📄 Script – Get JUnit Results

Once the run is finished:

  • Call the SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis - Cloud API to retrieve the JUnit report
  • Save it locally as junit-results.xml
  • Analysis: The XML is parsed, e.g., to read out the number of tests, errors, or runtimes.
					stage('Get JUnit Results') {
					powershell '''
					# Read token and execution ID from files
					$accessToken = Get-Content -Path "access_token.txt" -Raw
					$accessToken = $accessToken.Trim()
					$executionId = Get-Content -Path "execution_id.txt" -Raw
					$executionId = $executionId.Trim()
					function GetJUnitResults {
						param(
							[Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$AccessToken,
							[Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$TtaUrl,
							[Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$ExecutionId
						)
						try {
							$headers = @{
								"Authorization" = "Bearer $AccessToken"
								"Accept" = "application/xml"
							}
							$fullUrl = "$env:TTA_URL/_playlists/api/v2/playlistRuns/$ExecutionId/junit"
							$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $fullUrl -Method Get -Headers $headers
							# Save JUnit XML to file
							$junitXml = $response.OuterXml
							$junitXml | Out-File -FilePath "junit-results.xml" -Encoding UTF8
							# Parse and display summary
							$xmlDoc = [xml]$junitXml
							$testsuites = $xmlDoc.testsuites
							return $junitXml
						}
						catch {
							Write-Error "Failed to get JUnit results: $($_.Exception.Message)"
							throw
						}
					}
					$junitResults = GetJUnitResults $accessToken $env:TTA_URL $executionId
					Write-Host "JUnit results retrieved successfully"
					'''
                }

✅  Script – Check Final Status

  • Reads the test status from test_state.txt.
  • Stops the pipeline on error status (error, failed) with exit 1. If required, you can modify this to allow non-blocking behavior if needed.
  • Outputs a success message on positive completion.
stage('Check Final Status') {
                            powershell '''
                                # Read test state from file
                                $testState = Get-Content -Path "test_state.txt" -Raw
                                $testState = $testState.Trim()
                                if ($testState -eq 'error') {
                                    Write-Host "##[error]Tests error!"
                                    exit 1
                                } else {
                                    Write-Host "Tests run finished successfully!"
                                }
                            '''
					}

📊  Script - Publish Test Results

  • Uploads junit-results.xml
  • Displays test results in Jenkins
  • Prevents failure of empty reports
stage('Publish Test Results') {
            steps {
                script {
                    // Publish JUnit test results
                    if (fileExists('junit-results.xml')) {
                        junit testResults: 'junit-results.xml', allowEmptyResults: true, keepLongStdio: true
                        echo "Test results published successfully"
                    } else {
                        echo "No test result files found to publish"
                    }
                }
            }

Documentation & References

SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis - Cloud API: https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/references/tosca_apis.htm 

Conclusion

Following this setup allows you to fully automate your SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis test cases via Jenkins, complete with token management, playlist triggering, status monitoring, and test result reporting. This integration enables you to maintain high-quality test automation directly within your CI/CD pipelines.

entry.title: New in SAP Mobile Start V2.4: Integrate and Launch SAP Document AI on Mobile
entry.content:
With the SAP Mobile Start 2.4 release, users can leverage SAP Document AI—integrated seamlessly within the Mobile Start app—to transform document handling into a secure, intelligent, and automated experience. They can scan or upload documents directly from SAP Mobile Start, which are then processed by the SAP Document AI service. This streamlines processing, cuts down manual work, and boosts data accuracy throughout your operations. In this blog, I'll walk you through the integration steps, prerequisites, and configuration details needed to bring SAP Document AI capabilities to your mobile users. 

Preconditions 

Before you begin, ensure the following prerequisites are fulfilled. 

Subscribe to SAP Document AI

Ensure that your SAP BTP subaccount is subscribed to the Document Information Extraction service. You can follow this tutorial to get started. Once complete, access the SAP Document AI UI from your BTP subscriptions to configure document types and schemas relevant to your business scenarios. For more information on schema configuration, refer to the official user guide. 

Enable Identity Authentication for SAP Build Work Zone

In SAP Build Work Zone, navigate to Site Manager > Settings, and ensure Identity Authentication is enabled. 

Screenshot: Enabling Identity Authentication in SAP Build Work Zone Settings

Configure Trust Relationship for API Access

To allow SAP Build Work Zone to consume SAP Document AI APIs, you need to add a dependency in the SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS) administration console: 

  • Go to the Applications tab 
  • Select the SAP Build Work Zone application 
  • Under Dependencies, add a new entry with: 
  • Name: documentai (or any unique name) 
  • Application: Select the “SAP Document AI” entry in your IAS tenant 

Create Destination for SAP Mobile Start

To authorize SAP Mobile Start App to access SAP Document AI, create a destination in your BTP subaccount with the following settings: 

  • Name: sapdocumentaimobilestartintegration 
  • Type: HTTP 
  • Authentication: NoAuthentication 
  • Proxy Type: Internet 
  • URL: (Use https://<your-tenant-url-endpoint>/document-ai/v1, located in Document AI instance > service key > endpoints > backend > URL) 

Add the following additional properties: 

  • HTML5.DynamicDestination = true
  • HTML5.IASDependencyName = documentai (dependency name created in SAP Cloud Identity Services) 

Once completed, both SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start are authorized to access SAP Document AI. 

Configuring tile for SAP Document AI access in mobile 

To make SAP Document AI accessible via SAP Mobile Start: 

Step 1: Create a New App in Site Manager  

In SAP Build Work Zone, navigate to Site Manager > Content Manager and create a new App. 

  • Open App: In place 
  • URL: https://<your-tenant-url>/launchpad?sap-ushell-config=headerless#InboundDocument-manageInDocumentAI
    ℹ️ Use sap-ushell-config=headerless to hide the launchpad header
Step 2: Configure Navigation Parameters 

In the Navigation tab, add the following parameters: 

  • name: Schema name - Optional (from SAP Document AI UI > Schemas tab) 
  • latest: true, this signifies that only the latest version of the schema is used 
  • client_ID: Client ID (from SAP Document AI UI > Settings), preset to ‘default’ 
  • instance_ID: Instance ID (from SAP Document AI UI > Settings or BTP account > Instances > Select SAP Document AI instance) 
  • showWorkspaceHeader: true 
Step 3: Configure Visualization 

You can set your own preferred title, subtitle, icon. 

  • Visualisation Type: Static Tile 
  • Add the following name-value parameters:  
  • mobilestart.type: documentAi 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.clientId: (as specified in Navigation Tab parameters) 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.instanceId: (as specified in Navigation Tab parameters) 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.documentSchemaId: Optional - needed if only a specific schema scenario should be enabled, otherwise all active schemas will be shown to the end user. You can find Schema ID in SAP Document AI UI > Schemas tab 

Screenshot: SAP Document AI Tile Visualization in SAP Build Work Zone

You’ve now created a fully functional SAP Document AI tile for SAP Mobile Start! 🚀 

User Experience in SAP Mobile Start 

As a business user, you can locate the newly created SAP Document AI tile in the SAP Mobile Start app using the Search function. For easier access, you can also add the tile to your Favorites. When you tap the tile, you’ll be directed to a native document selection screen. Depending on how the service was configured by the administrator, you may have the option to select a document type and schema. If the tile is configured for a specific schema use case, it will be automatically selected. 

Screenshot: SAP Document AI tile in SAP Mobile Start App 

Upload Options 

  1. Scan via Camera – Leverages the device’s native camera with real-time preview, cropping, rotation, and filtering. Multiple scans are compiled into a single PDF. 
  2. Select Images from Gallery – Users choose previously captured images which are compiled into a single PDF. 
  3. Select File from File Explorer – Users upload a single PDF from their device’s file system. 

 Screenshot: Scanning a document via device’s native camera  

Upload Validation & Handling 

Before uploading a document, the app performs several validation checks to ensure compatibility. The file size must not exceed 50 MB, and the document should contain no more than 100 pages. Additionally, file names are automatically sanitized to remove any invalid characters. Once these checks are successfully passed, the upload process begins, with a visible progress bar indicating status. Android users can upload multiple documents synchronously.  

After the upload is complete, the document extraction workflow is triggered, and users receive a success notification confirming the process. 

Track Status and Review Document 

To monitor the progress of document extraction, simply open the Document Overview from the overflow menu within the document selection screen. This action launches the mobile-optimized SAP Document AI UI, providing a clear and intuitive view of the status, allowing reviews and other updates related to your uploaded documents. 

Screenshot: Track status and review document via mobile optimized UI 

Conclusion 

With the release of SAP Mobile Start 2.4 and the seamless integration of SAP Document AI, business users now benefit from a truly mobile-first, intelligent document processing experience. Whether it's capturing receipts on the go, processing invoices, or extracting data from complex forms, SAP Document AI empowers users to automate workflows efficiently—right from their mobile devices. This integration brings the power of AI-driven document handling directly to your fingertips, enabling smarter, faster, and more scalable business operations.

entry.title: Re: Logic for calculation of the actual coverage in the "...
entry.content:
Even without a coverage profile assigned, SAP still calculates Actual Coverage in the MD04 → Period Totals view using a straightforward logic based on available quantity and future requirements.

How SAP Calculates Actual Coverage (in Days) is that it uses the following logic:

  • Start with the available stock on the current date.
  • Look ahead into the future requirements (planned orders, sales orders, dependent requirements).
  • Determine how many calendar days the available stock will last, based on the cumulative requirements.

The formula is Actual Coverage (days) = Available Quantity / Average Daily Requirement

So below are the two cases based on your post

Case 1:

  • Available Quantity: 288.012
  • Requirements: 525.400
  • Actual Coverage: 15.5 days

SAP checks the requirement quantities day by day:

  • Day 1: Requirement = X → Remaining stock = 288.012 – X
  • Day 2: Requirement = Y → Remaining stock = previous – Y
  • ...
  • On Day 15.5: Stock reaches zero


Case 2:

  • Available Quantity: 578.188
  • Requirements: 58.228
  • Actual Coverage: 34.2 days

Here, the daily requirement is much lower, so the available stock lasts longer.

entry.title: How you can manage polish KSeF Requirement in SAP S/⁠4HANA Cloud Private Edition & SAP S/⁠4HANA
entry.content:
In my last Blogpost I introduced you into How Official Document Numbering helps to fulfil the Polish KSeF Requirements in S4HANA Public Cloud.

 

The aim of this new Blog is to give you a concrete example, how the new ODN Framework can help customers having business in Poland to fulfill the new legal requirement of KSeF (Dz.U. 2023 poz. 1598) with SAP S/⁠4HANA Cloud Private Edition & SAP S/⁠4HANA.

 

The alternative Solution for SAP ERP can be found in those two Notes:

  • 3423256 - ECC Only : KSeF number enablement for FI postings and line item reports - SAP for Me
  • 3451944 - KSeF number enablement for MIRO postings - SAP for Me

 

 Process Overview

  • For the Outbound Process of Sales Invoices, the following process flow is applicable:

 

  • For the Inbound Process of Vendor Invoices, the following process flows as follows:

 

 

 

Configuration

1.  Maintain Official Document Number Types - Transaction: “ODNTYP”

 

Create the ODN Types (Examples):

  • ZKSeF - Poland B2B KSeF reference number

 

 

 

2.  Map Official Document Number Type to Internal Type
- Transaction: “ODNINTTYP”

 

Map your custom official document number type to the SAP-delivered internal official document number type so that the system can correctly derive the official document number within your consuming application.

Procedure

  • In your configuration environment, search for and open the Map Official Document Number Type to Internal Type activity.
  • In the ODN Country/Region field, type PL and choose Apply.
  • Choose New Entries.
  • In the ODN Internal Type field, choose the SAP-delivered internal official document number type PLKSEF
  • In the ODN Type field, choose your custom official document number type; for example, ZKSEF
  • Save your changes.

 

 

3.  Configure Official Document Number Type Characteristics TA: “ODNTYPC”

 

Set the properties of your custom official document number type, such as its length and how it is processed.

 

Procedure

  • In your configuration environment, search for and open the Configure Official Document Number Type Characteristics activity.
  • In the ODN Country/Region field, type PL and choose Apply.
  • In the Assign Official Document Number Types to Country step, choose New Entries and add your custom official document number types from above.
  • Choose the new entry you have added for your custom official document number type and then go to User Interface Settings.
  • In the ODN Length field, enter the length as 35.
  • In the Legal Timestamp field, choose Generic Format as we want to enable legal timestamp.
  • Go to Process Specific Settings.
  • Choose New Entries and add the following entry:
    • For ZKSEF:

 

 

 

  • FI_CUSTOMER_INV:

 

  • MM_SUPPLIER_INV:

 

  • SD_BILLING_HEADER:

Save your changes.

 

Example – Supplier Invoice via transaction MIRO

 

  • Enter the invoice relevant data and then press “Additional Fiscal Data”

 

 

  • Now Enter the Official Document Numbers relevant for your transactions in Poland (KSeF):

 

 

 

Example – Customer Invoice via KSeF Portal

 

  • Submit and receive the Billing Invoice via EDocument Cockpit

 

  • The KSeF Number will be visible on the Billing Document Header itself:

 

 

 

More information

The Business Processes and SAP Help Documentation for ODN Numbers in Poland can be found here:

Business Area

Supported Business Processes

Description

Document and Reporting Compliance

Customer invoices exchanged using Document and Reporting Compliance

The system records the KSeF reference number assigned by the tax authorities to customer invoices exchanged using Document and Reporting Compliance.

Sourcing and Procurement

Supplier invoices in Sourcing and Procurement

You can manually maintain the official document number in supplier invoices. The system validates this value based on the properties maintained in the configuration.

 

Data Access via CDS Views:

Process

CDS View

SD Billing

I_BillingDocumentODN

FI Customer/Supplier invoice

I_AccountingDocumentODN

MM Supplier Invoice

I_SupplierInvoiceODN

 

 

 

Availability of the solution

 

The solution shown before is available for SAP S/⁠4HANA Cloud Private Edition & SAP S/⁠4HANA Versions 1709 – 2025.

In general, there are two ways of consuming the solution.

  1. You can install the next feature Package for your S/4HANA Solution
  2. You can install the notes which have been released recently:
    • In this case refer to the note collection in SAP Note 3565339 for additional details and please also check the prerequisites carefully!

 

Important:

Please note that you also need to implement a DRC Note to have direct integration with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to sync the KSeF Number from Tax Portal towards your business documents.

This note will be available very soon.

 

I hope that I was able to provide you a good overview about how use the new ODN Framework to manage the Polish KSeF Requirement in SAP S/⁠4HANA Cloud Private Edition & SAP S/⁠4HANA

 

Thanks and see you next time!

 

Christian Seelinger

entry.title: Re: Email is not getting triggered for suser id
entry.content:
After reviewing the details, I can confirm that the provided email ID appears to be in good standing and functioning as expected. Since the S-user S0027278955 is already linked to an SAP Universal ID 'shrenik@stellium.com' , to reset the SAP Universal ID, please follow the steps below: 

  1. Go to SAP for Me: https://me.sap.com and if not signed in, click Sign In top right 
  2. Enter the UID e-mail address and click Continue
  3. Click Forgot password?
  4. A reset link will be sent to the email ID 
  5. When the user receive the e-mail, click the Reset your password link or copy the provided link and paste into a browser
  6. Create a new password and make sure that the password has a minimum of 8 characters and includes 3 of the following:
    • Lowercase letters
    • Uppercase letters
    • Number [0-9]
    • Symbols [!@#^&*()+_,.{}?-]
  7. Click Save
  8. The user will receive a confirmation e-mail 

For additional details, you can refer to KBA 2882938 - How to reset or change SAP Universal ID (UID) password

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: ローカルのCAP Javaプロジェクトからリモート OData API へ接続する手順
entry.content:
目的

ローカルの CAP Java プロジェクトから、SAP S/4HANA の Sandbox OData API を呼び出してデータを取得する手順の一例をまとめます。最終的には、以下のURLにアクセスしてBusiness Partnersを取得することをゴールとします。

http://localhost:8080/odata/v4/BusinessPartnerService/BusinessPartner 

1. 検証時の環境

  •  SAP BTP トライアル環境

  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub の Sandbox 環境
  • 開発環境: Visual Studio Code 
  • Maven  3.9
  • OpenJDK 21

2. プロジェクトの作成

2.1. CAP Javaプロジェクトの初期化

cds init cap-java-remote-api --add destination,xsuaa --java

初期化後、以下のようなプロジェクトフォルダーが作成されます。

2.2. プロジェクトをVisual Studio Code で開く

code cap-java-remote-api

3. ライブラリの追加

リモート OData API に接続するには、SAP Cloud SDK と リモート OData用のライブラリが必要です。

3.1. ルートディレクトリのpom.xml に SAP Cloud SDK の最新のバージョンをプロパティとして追加し、dependencyManagement に sdk-bom を追加します。

<properties>
    ...
    <!-- 最新のSDKのバージョンに置き換える -->
    <cloud-sdk.version>5.20.0</cloud-sdk.version>
</properties>
...
<dependencyManagement>
	<dependencies>
        ...
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.sap.cloud.sdk</groupId>
            <artifactId>sdk-bom</artifactId>
            <version>${cloud-sdk.version}</version>
            <type>pom</type>
            <scope>import</scope>
        </dependency>
	</dependencies>
</dependencyManagement>

3.2. srv/pom.xmlに以下のライブラリを追加します。

<dependencies>
    ...
    <dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cds</groupId>
		<artifactId>cds-feature-remote-odata</artifactId>
		<scope>runtime</scope>
	</dependency>

	<dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cloud.sdk</groupId>
		<artifactId>sdk-core</artifactId>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>

4. ODataメタデータの取得とCSNの生成

OData API を使うには、ODataのエンティティやプロパティ情報を記載したメタデータファイル(EDMX)から、CAP内部の共通モデル表現として役割を果たす、CSN形式に変換した上で、CDSでのモデリングを行う必要があります。

4.1. SAP Business Accelerator HubのBusiness Partner (A2X)からEDMXをダウンロード

https://api.sap.com/api/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/overview

4.2. ルートディレクトリの配下に.edmxファイルを格納

4.3. .edmxから.csn を生成

cds import API_BUSINESS_PARTNER.edmx

実行後、 srv/external フォルダに .edmx と .csn ファイルが生成されます。 

加えて、application.yaml に Destination Service のテンプレート設定が追加されます。

5. 接続設定

S/4HANA のような外部システムと接続する際に、他サービスからの再利用性も高く、接続先や認証情報を設定できるBTP の Destination Service を利用します。今回はSandbox 環境のため、APIKeyでの認証を行い、.envファイルにその情報を格納しますが、実運用環境では他の適切な認証方式を使用してください。

5.1. BTP Destination Service に S/4HANA Sandbox の情報を登録

  • Name: S4Sandbox
  • Type: HTTP
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • URL: https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud
  • Authentication: NoAuthentication
    • Sandbox環境のため、ここではNoAuthenticationを選択し、後続のapplication.yamlにてAPIKeyを.env経由で渡します。

5.2. .envにAPIKeyを設定

APIキーはBusiness Accelerator Hubから取得できます。

APIKey=<Business Accelerator Hubで取得したAPIキー>

5.3. application.yamlで接続先の設定

cds:
  remote:
    services:
      API_BUSINESS_PARTNER:
        destination:
          # 対象のDestination Serviceで登録したDestination名を記載する
          name: S4Sandbox
        http:
          suffix: /sap/opu/odata/sap
          # Sandbox APIを使用する場合には、APIKeyをHTTPヘッダーに入れる必要がある
          headers:
            # 環境変数のAPIKeyを参照する
            APIKey: ${APIKey}
        type: odata-v2

6. サービスモデルとハンドラの実装

6.1 srv/business-partner-service.cdsにサービスモデルを実装

using {API_BUSINESS_PARTNER as bp} from './external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER';

service BusinessPartnerService @(requires: 'any') {
    entity BusinessPartner as projection on bp.A_BusinessPartner {
        key A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartner,
            A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartnerName,
            A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartnerFullName
    };
}

先ほど作成した .csn に含まれる API_BUSINESS_PARTNER を投影し、サービスモデルのエンティティ BusinessPartner を定義します。

6.2. srv/src/main/java/customer/cap_java_remote_api/handlers/BusinessPartnerHandler.javaにハンドラを実装

package customer.cap_java_remote_api.handlers;

import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;

import com.sap.cds.Result;
import com.sap.cds.services.cds.CdsReadEventContext;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.EventHandler;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.annotations.On;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.annotations.ServiceName;

import cds.gen.api_business_partner.ApiBusinessPartner;
import cds.gen.businesspartnerservice.BusinessPartner_;
import org.slf4j.Logger;
import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

@Component
@ServiceName("BusinessPartnerService")
public class BusinessPartnerHandler implements EventHandler {

    @Autowired
    ApiBusinessPartner remoteBp;

    private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BusinessPartnerHandler.class);
    // このブログサービスの仕様でアットマークとそれに付随する文字列が消えてしまいます。下記のコードに置き換えてください。
    (entity = BusinessPartner_.CDS_NAME)
    public Result readBusinessPartner(CdsReadEventContext context) {
        try {
            logger.info("Reading Business Partner data from S/4HANA with CQN: {}", context.getCqn());
            return remoteBp.run(context.getCqn());
        } catch (Exception e) {
            logger.error("Error while reading Business Partner data from S/4HANA.", e);
            throw new RuntimeException(e);
        }
    }
}

上記でコメントした行をこちらに置き換えてください。

'@On(entity = BusinessPartner_.CDS_NAME)'

また、CQNを使用する際は、CqnServiceを継承したインターフェイスを使用します。今回でいうと、remoteBpのインターフェイスであるApiBusinessPartnerは、CqnServiceを継承しています。

7. デプロイ準備

ローカルで開発したCAP JavaアプリケーションをSAP BTPのCloud Foundry環境へデプロイするための準備を行います。

7.1. MTAファイルの作成

cds add mta

mta.yamlが生成されますが、modulesに記載のcap-java-remote-api-srvが生成されただけではなく、プロジェクト初期化の際にaddオプションでつけた、xsuaaとdestinationがそれぞれバッキングサービスとしてresourcesに記載されていることが確認できます。

加えて、srv/pom.xmlに以下のライブラリが追加されます。

<dependencies>
    ...
    <dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cds</groupId>
		<artifactId>cds-starter-cloudfoundry</artifactId>
		<scope>runtime</scope>
	</dependency>

	<dependency>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>

7.2. ビルド&ローカルリポジトリへのインストール

mvn clean install

8. BTPへデプロイ

8.1. mtarファイルの作成

mbt build --mtar archive
#  CAPを扱う際には、前回のビルド成果物を削除したいケースが多いので、
# 下記のコマンドを叩くことが多いです。
# rm -rf mta_archives && mbt build --mtar archive

8.2. 対象のCloud Foundry環境を選択

BTP CockpitのサブアカウントページからAPI Endpointを取得できます。

cf api <対象のCFエンドポイント>

8.3. Cloud Foundryにログイン

cf login

8.4. Cloud Foundryにデプロイ

cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar
# デプロイが失敗した時には三度のリトライがデフォルトで実施されますが、
# 一度だけで済ませても問題ないケースが多いので、時間短縮のために、下記のコマンドをよく使います。
# cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar --retries 1

 8.5. BTP Cockpitでデプロイ結果を確認

9. ローカルからリモートAPIへアクセス

最後に、ローカル環境からリモートOData APIにアクセスします。そのためには、BTPにデプロイしたバッキングサービスをローカルにバインドする必要があります。

9.1. BTP上のxsuaaとdestinationをローカルにバインド

cds bind auth --to cap-java-remote-api-auth
cds bind destination --to cap-java-remote-api-destination

このバインドにより、ハイブリッド環境用のバッキングサービスの設定が行えます。

9.2. Hybrid Testing

cds bind --exec -- mvn spring-boot:run

9.3. 対象エンドポイントにて、結果を確認

http://localhost:8080/odata/v4/BusinessPartnerService/BusinessPartner

CAP Javaプロジェクトのお役に立てれば幸いです！

entry.title: How to Call a Remote OData API from Your Local CAP Java Project
entry.content:
Objective

This post walks you through how to call the SAP S/4HANA sandbox OData API from a local CAP Java project.
The final goal is to call the following endpoint and retrieve a list of business partners:
http://localhost:8080/odata/v4/BusinessPartnerService/BusinessPartner

1. Testing Environment

  • SAP BTP Trial
  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub – Sandbox
  • IDE: Visual Studio Code
  • Maven 3.9
  • OpenJDK 21

2. Project Setup

2.1 Initialize a CAP Java project

cds init cap-java-remote-api --add destination,xsuaa --java

The command creates the following folder structure:

2.2 Open the project in VS Code

code cap-java-remote-api

3. Add Required Libraries

To call a remote OData service you need both the SAP Cloud SDK and the CAP library for remote OData.

3.1 Add the  latest SDK version to the properties and the Cloud SDK BOM to the root pom.xml

<properties>
    ...
    <!-- Replace with the latest SDK version -->
    <cloud-sdk.version>5.20.0</cloud-sdk.version>
</properties>
...
<dependencyManagement>
	<dependencies>
        ...
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.sap.cloud.sdk</groupId>
            <artifactId>sdk-bom</artifactId>
            <version>${cloud-sdk.version}</version>
            <type>pom</type>
            <scope>import</scope>
        </dependency>
	</dependencies>
</dependencyManagement>

3.2 Add the following dependencies to srv/pom.xml

<dependencies>
    ...
    <dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cds</groupId>
		<artifactId>cds-feature-remote-odata</artifactId>
		<scope>runtime</scope>
	</dependency>

	<dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cloud.sdk</groupId>
		<artifactId>sdk-core</artifactId>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>

4. Fetch OData Metadata and Generate CSN

CAP needs a CSN file, so you must first download the EDMX file and convert it.

4.1 Download the Business Partner (A2X) EDMX from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub
https://api.sap.com/api/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/overview

4.2 Place the .edmx file in the project’s root folder.

4.3 Generate a .csn file from the .edmx

cds import API_BUSINESS_PARTNER.edmx

After execution, both the .edmx and .csn files appear in srv/external.

A template for the Destination Service is also added to application.yaml.

5. Connectivity Configuration

You will use the BTP Destination Service to store the connectivity settings such as the URL and authentication. Because you are calling the sandbox, authentication is done via an API Key stored in a local .env file. In a productive scenario you would switch to a more secure authentication method.

5.1 Create a destination in BTP

  • Name: S4Sandbox
  • Type: HTTP
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • URL: https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud
  • Authentication: NoAuthentication

5.2 Store the API Key in .env

You can get the API Key on Business Accelerator Hub.

APIKey=<your-API-key-from-Business-Accelerator-Hub>

5.3 Configure the destination in application.yaml

cds:
  remote:
    services:
      API_BUSINESS_PARTNER:
        destination:
          # Name of the destination you just created
          name: S4Sandbox
        http:
          suffix: /sap/opu/odata/sap
          # The sandbox requires the API Key in a header
          headers:
            # Read from the env file
            APIKey: ${APIKey}
        type: odata-v2

6. Service Model and Handler

6.1 Define the service model in srv/business-partner-service.cds

using {API_BUSINESS_PARTNER as bp} from './external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER';

service BusinessPartnerService @(requires: 'any') {
    entity BusinessPartner as projection on bp.A_BusinessPartner {
        key A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartner,
            A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartnerName,
            A_BusinessPartner.BusinessPartnerFullName
    };
}

Project the API_BUSINESS_PARTNER definition from the .csn file you just created and use it to define the BusinessPartner entity in your service model.

6.2 Implement the handler in
srv/src/main/java/customer/cap_java_remote_api/handlers/BusinessPartnerHandler.java

package customer.cap_java_remote_api.handlers;

import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;

import com.sap.cds.Result;
import com.sap.cds.services.cds.CdsReadEventContext;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.EventHandler;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.annotations.On;
import com.sap.cds.services.handler.annotations.ServiceName;

import cds.gen.api_business_partner.ApiBusinessPartner;
import cds.gen.businesspartnerservice.BusinessPartner_;
import org.slf4j.Logger;
import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

@Component
@ServiceName("BusinessPartnerService")
public class BusinessPartnerHandler implements EventHandler {

    @Autowired
    ApiBusinessPartner remoteBp;

    private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BusinessPartnerHandler.class);
    // This blogging platform strips out the “@” symbol and 'On' that follows it, so please replace the above line with the code shown below.
    (entity = BusinessPartner_.CDS_NAME)
    public Result readBusinessPartner(CdsReadEventContext context) {
        try {
            logger.info("Reading Business Partner data from S/4HANA with CQN: {}", context.getCqn());
            return remoteBp.run(context.getCqn());
        } catch (Exception e) {
            logger.error("Error while reading Business Partner data from S/4HANA.", e);
            throw new RuntimeException(e);
        }
    }
}

Please replace the commented line above with the following code:

'@On(entity = BusinessPartner_.CDS_NAME)'

When you work with CQN, use an interface that extends CqnService. In this case, the interface for remoteBp, ApiBusinessPartner, does exactly that: it extends CqnService.

7. Prepare for Deployment

7.1 Generate an MTA descriptor

cds add mta

The generated mta.yaml now contains a module (cap-java-remote-api-srv) and the backing services (xsuaa, destination) that you added during init.

The following dependencies are also auto-added to srv/pom.xml:

<dependencies>
    ...
    <dependency>
		<groupId>com.sap.cds</groupId>
		<artifactId>cds-starter-cloudfoundry</artifactId>
		<scope>runtime</scope>
	</dependency>

	<dependency>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>

7.2 Build the project and install to your local Maven repo

mvn clean install

8. Deploy to BTP

8.1 Create an .mtar file

mbt build --mtar archive
# It is often useful to clean old artifacts:
# rm -rf mta_archives && mbt build --mtar archive

8.2 Target the correct Cloud Foundry org/space

You can obtain the targeted Endpoint from the BTP Cockpit:

cf api <your Cloud Foundry endpoint>

8.3 Log in to Cloud Foundry

cf login

8.4 Deploy to Cloud Foundry

cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar
# Skip the default 3 retries to save time:
# cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar --retries 1

8.5 Verify the deployment in the BTP Cockpit

9. Access the Remote API from Your Local Environment

Because the backing services live on BTP, you need to bind them locally for hybrid testing.

9.1 Bind xsuaa and destination locally

cds bind auth --to cap-java-remote-api-auth
cds bind destination --to cap-java-remote-api-destination

9.2 Run the application in hybrid mode

cds bind --exec -- mvn spring-boot:run

9.3 Open the endpoint

http://localhost:8080/odata/v4/BusinessPartnerService/BusinessPartner

You should now see the list of business partners fetched from the SAP S/4HANA sandbox.

I hope this helps you kick-start your CAP Java project!

entry.title: Re: DB2 11.5 LUW - HADR rebuild from online backup ?
entry.content:
Hello Brian, you can start the HADR pair as soon as the restore on the standby has been finished and the HADR-related configuration (like local host, remote host, ...) has been done.
The standby will then start performing  the remote catchup and the primary will get any needed log files from its archive to provide them to the standby for rollforward.

It is best practice to set up the same log archiving location (aka shared archive) for both the primary as well as the standby anyhow, being accessible by both the primary and the standby.
If you have different locations, in case of a HADR failover, archived log files of the former standby / new primary will go to this different location then.  And, as you can imagine, with several failovers forth and back, you will have a mixture of archived logs in different locations which may need manual intervention in case of recovery.
Link to relevant documentation: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/db2/11.5.x?topic=hadr-log-archiving-configuration
